benchmark_details.name: Twitter Big Data as a Resource for Exoskeleton Research: A Large-Scale Dataset of about 140,000 Tweets and 100 Research Questions
benchmark_details.overview: This work presents an open-access dataset of about 140,000 tweets about exoskeletons that were posted in a 5-year period from May 21, 2017, to May 21, 2022.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale Twitter dataset for studying user interest, views, opinions, attitudes toward exoskeletons and to pose 100 research questions for further investigation.

data.source: Tweets collected from Twitter using the Search Twitter operator in RapidMiner and the Advanced Search feature of the Twitter API.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using the Twitter API.

methodology.calculation: Count of tweet IDs and statistical analysis of tweet characteristics.
methodology.interpretation: Studying trends in user interest and engagement towards exoskeletons based on the dataset.
methodology.validation: Dataset is validated through comprehensive review of prior works in relevant fields and compliance with Twitterâ€™s developer agreement.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is anonymized by resctricting shared information to only Tweet IDs as per Twitter guidelines.
